docs.lead_paragraph: Some Medicare beneficiaries were pleasantly surprised and saved money, but others were frustrated this week as the prescription drug benefit got off to an uneven start across the country. People who applied early and had identification cards in hand were often able to fill prescriptions through the new program, the most significant expansion of Medicare since its creation 40 years ago. But others were stymied in their efforts to take advantage of the drug benefit, as pharmacists spent hours trying to confirm eligibility and enrollment by telephone and computer.

headline.main: Start of Medicare Drug Plan Sees Successes and Struggles

docs.snippet: Some beneficiaries were pleasantly surprised while others were frustrated as the new drug benefit got off to an uneven start.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR; Albert Salvato contributed reporting from Cincinnati for this article
